ability.name: Vital Essence Sublimation III (Nilo)
ability.description: Your success improves further: Common, Uncommon, and Rare potions no longer fail; only Very Rare (40%) and Legendary (60%) can fail.\nYou can now hold up to three distilled essences at a time.

ability.name: Vital Essence Sublimation III (Nilo)
ability.description: Your success improves further: Common, Uncommon, and Rare potions no longer fail; only Very Rare (40%) and Legendary (60%) can fail.\nYou can now hold up to three distilled essences at a time.

changes.oldValue: As an Action, you channel the pure essence of poison to conjure a monstrous, hissing Snake Horror in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet. The creature is friendly to you and your companions, acts immediately after you in the initiative order, and remains for 1 hour, until it drops to 0 hit points, or until you dismiss it as an action.\nYou can now hold up to three distilled essences at a time.
changes.newValue: As an Action, you channel the pure essence of poison to conjure a monstrous, hissing Snake Horror in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet. The creature is friendly to you and your companions, acts immediately after you in the initiative order, and remains for 1 hour, until it drops to 0 hit points, or until you dismiss it as an action.

ability.name: Extended Reach
ability.description: Your skill with explosive devices allows you to strike from farther away. When you create or use an explosive, its range to the target point is doubled. For example, a bomb that can normally be thrown or placed within 30 feet can now target a point up to 60 feet away.

ability.name: Seven-Color Elixir
ability.description:
As a bonus action, you drink one of your seven elixirs and roll 1d8 to determine the effect. On a 1–7, you gain the corresponding elixir’s effect. On an 8, you may choose any of the seven.

    1. Crimson Veil — Greater invisibility for 1 minute.
    2. Azure Sight — True seeing for 10 minutes.
    3. Golden Mirage — Four illusory duplicates (mirror image).
    4. Emerald Phantasm — Hallucinatory terrain in a 150-foot radius.
    5. Violet Confusion — Confusion affecting all creatures within 30 feet.
    6. Silver Displacement — Mislead effect.
    7.Obsidian Terror — Fear in a 30-foot cone.

ability.name: Erosion of Being
ability.description: As an action, target a creature within 60 feet to make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d8 acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. On a failed save, the creature begins dissolving into nothingness and is banished to a harmless demiplane for 1 minute. If reduced to 0 hit points by this damage, it dissolves completely and is permanently destroyed (no resurrection except by Wish). At the end of each turn while banished, the creature takes 2d8 acid damage and can repeat the save, returning on a success.

ability.name: Chaos Manipulation
ability.description: Once per long rest, you can cause a minor chaotic effect within 30 feet, such as causing objects to tremble, flicker, or shift unpredictably. The effect lasts for 1 minute and can create distractions or disorient opponents.

changes.oldValue: Your expertise in crafting explosives has improved the effectiveness of your bombs. When you create or use an explosive device, you increase its radius by 10 feet. For example, a bomb that normally affects a 10-foot radius now affects a 15-foot radius. This increased radius applies to all explosive effects you create, including those from your Improvised Explosives and any similar abilities.
changes.newValue: Your expertise in crafting explosives has improved the effectiveness of your bombs. When you create or use an explosive device, you increase its radius by 10 feet. For example, a bomb that normally affects a 10-foot radius now affects a 20-foot radius. This increased radius applies to all explosive effects you create, including those from your Improvised Explosives and any similar abilities.

ability.name: Fortune Favors the Swift
ability.description: Whenever you expend a spell slot, you gain a d6 “wind die”. You can add it to one d20 roll before the end of your next turn.

ability.name: Liberation’s Gale
ability.description: A cleansing wind sweeps from you to creatures within 60 feet. Choose up to six targets; each immediately ends one of the following conditions: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Restrained, or Stunned. For 1 minute, those creatures also have advantage on saves against those same conditions.For 1 minute, you become an unyielding force. You can’t be knocked prone, grappled, restrained, paralyzed, stunned, or moved against your will. Whenever you hit a creature with a melee attack, you may push it 10 feet or knock it prone. The ground cracks beneath your steady steps.

ability.name: Just Passing By
ability.description: As a reaction, you dissolve into wind until the start of your next turn, passing through solid objects, becoming immune to nonmagical slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage and resistant to magical slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage.

ability.name: Lunar Wind Spiral
ability.description: As an Action, you target a point within 150 feet; a cylinder of swirling, moonlight-infused winds erupts in a 30-foot radius and 60-foot height. When the spiral appears, each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw against your essence ability save DC, taking 6d8 Radiant damage on a failed save and being lifted 20 feet into the air until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not lifted. The effect lasts for 1 minute. Any creature that starts its turn in the area or enters it for the first time on a turn must make the saving throw, taking 3d6 Radiant damage on a failed save, or half on a successful one, but it is not lifted. You can use a Bonus Action on a subsequent turn to move the area of effect by up to 30 feet.

ability.name: Waning Moon Sabers
ability.description: As a bonus action, launch up to three crescent-shaped energy blades that travel 150 feet. Each saber makes a ranged spell attack for 1d4 + 1 Radiant damage. On a hit, the target must make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of their next turn as moonlight sears their vision. On a critical hit, the target automatically fails the saving throw. The sabers curve around cover, ignoring half and three-quarters cover.

ability.name: Misty Veil
ability.description: You can create a shroud of mist around you that obscures your appearance, granting advantage on Stealth checks to hide and disadvantage on Insight checks to discern your true intentions. This effect lasts for 1 hour.

changes.oldValue: You can move with such speed and silence that your footsteps echo faintly. You gain advantage on Stealth checks, and creatures within 10 feet of you have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to hear you. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.
changes.newValue: You can move with such speed and silence that your footsteps echo faintly. You gain advantage on Stealth checks, and creatures within 100 feet of you have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to hear you. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.

changes.oldValue: As a reaction to being targeted by an attack or harmful spell, you can summon a barrier of wind around you. You gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws until the start of your next turn. Additionally, ranged weapon attacks against you have disadvantage.
changes.newValue: As a reaction to being targeted by an attack or harmful spell, you can summon a barrier of wind around you. You gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws until the start of your next turn. Additionally, attacks against you have disadvantage.

changes.oldValue: When you use the Dash action, you can create a swirling vortex of wind around you. Creatures within 5 feet of your path must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The wind dissipates at the end of your movement.
changes.newValue: When you use the Dash action, you can create a swirling vortex of wind around you. Creatures within 10 feet of your path must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The wind dissipates at the end of your movement.

changes.oldValue: When you hit a creature of your size or smaller, or any creature one size category larger than you, with a weapon attack, you can create a gust of wind that forces the creature to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed 10 feet away from you.
changes.newValue: When you hit a creature of your size or smaller, or any creature one size category larger than you, with an attack or spell, you can create a gust of wind that forces the creature to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed 10 feet in any direction you choose.

changes.oldValue: https://www.dandwiki.com/wiki/Whirlwind_(5e_Spell)
changes.newValue: https://5e.tools/spells.html#whirlwind_xge

ability.name: Immovable Mountain
ability.description: For 1 minute, you become an unyielding force. You can’t be knocked prone, grappled, restrained, paralyzed, stunned, or moved against your will. Whenever you hit a creature with a melee attack, you may push it 10 feet or knock it prone. The ground cracks beneath your steady steps.

ability.name: Stone Fist III
ability.description: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d10 bludgeoning damage and count as magical for overcoming resistance and immunity.

ability.name: Foolish Old Man Moves Mountains
ability.description: Each time you fail a saving throw against a hostile creature’s effect, your abilities DC increases by 1 until you complete a long rest. This increase can stack up to a maximum of +3.

changes.oldValue: Gain proficiency in History. If already proficient, add double your proficiency bonus to History checks related to the origin of stonework.
changes.newValue: Gain proficiency in History. If already proficient, you gain expertise.

changes.oldValue: Gain expertise (double proficiency bonus) in Athletics when performing tasks involving lifting, pushing, or pulling heavy objects made of stone or earth.
changes.newValue: Gain expertise in Athletics when performing tasks involving lifting, pushing, or pulling heavy objects made of stone or earth.

changes.oldValue: You have advantage on Stealth checks to hide in rocky terrain or against stone surfaces.
changes.newValue: You have expertise on Stealth checks to hide in rocky terrain or against stone surfaces.

ability.name: Frightful Pursuit
ability.description: You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that is currently frightened.

ability.name: Martyr’s Flame Aura
ability.description: You wreathe yourself in holy fire for 1 minute (concentration), creating a 30-foot aura that grants allies fire resistance. When an ally enters the aura or starts their turn inside it, they gain temporary hit points equal to 2d6 + your Charisma modifier. The flames warm and protect, never harm.

ability.name: Shadowflame Dream
ability.description: As an Action, you hurl a swirling torrent of flames laced with negative energy at one creature within 60 feet. The target must make a Charisma saving throw against your essence ability save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes 5d10 Fire damage and 5d10 Necrotic damage and falls Unconscious until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target only takes the fire damage and is not affected by the unconscious condition.

changes.oldValue: When you focus intently on a creature for 1 minute, you can attempt an Intimidation check. If successful, the creature is unsettled and has disadvantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed by you for 1 hour.
changes.newValue: As a bonus action, you can attempt an Intimidation check. If successful, the creature is unsettled and has disadvantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed by you for 1 minute.

changes.oldValue: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a spell slot to deal an additional 1d12 fire damage per level of the spell slot expended.
changes.newValue: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a spell slot to deal an additional 1d12 fire damage per level of the spell slot expended. Additionaly, the target must also succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell Save DC or become frightened of you until the end of its next turn.

changes.oldValue: When you use the Disengage action, you create a burst of fire around you. Each creature within 5 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 fire damage and catches fire. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage.
changes.newValue: When you use the Disengage action, you create a burst of fire around you. Each creature within 5 feet of you takes 2d6 fire damage.

ability.name: Arc Chain
ability.description: Choose a creature within 120 feet. It makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d8 lightning damage on a failure or half on a success. If it fails, the bolt leaps to another creature within 30 feet that hasn’t been hit yet, forcing the same save. The chain continues jumping to new creatures until one succeeds on its save or no valid targets remain.

ability.name: Lightning Cage
ability.description: You conjure a crackling triangular cage of lightning in a 30-foot area centered on a point within 90 feet, lasting 1 minute. Creatures inside have their speed halved and can’t take reactions. Any creature that touches the cage’s edge takes 4d10 lightning damage. A creature inside may use its action to attempt a Strength save to break through: on a failure, it remains trapped and takes 4d10 lightning damage; on a success, it escapes and takes half the damage.

ability.name: Extinguishing Lightning
ability.description: As an action, unleash consuming black lightning in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d12 lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. Creatures that fail also have one ongoing magical effect on them immediately end (your choice).

ability.name: Electrostatic Charm
ability.description: Your affinity with lightning allows you to charm and influence those you meet. You can use your Charisma (Deception) or Charisma (Performance) checks to impress or beguile others, gaining advantage in social situations where you can appeal to your stormy, dynamic persona.

changes.oldValue: You can make a dramatic entrance by creating a booming thunderclap that announces your presence. This effect grants you advantage on Charisma (Performance) checks to make a memorable first impression.
changes.newValue: You can make a dramatic entrance by creating a booming thunderclap that announces your presence. This effect grants you expertise on Charisma (Performance) checks to make a memorable first impression.

changes.oldValue: https://www.dandwiki.com/wiki/Lightning_Lure_(5e_Spell) \"Lightning Lure (5e Spell)\
changes.newValue: https://5e.tools/spells.html#lightning%20lure_tce

changes.newValue: https://5e.tools/spells.html#shocking%20grasp_xphb

changes.newValue: https://5e.tools/spells.html#witch%20bolt_xphb

ability.name: Weight of Lives
ability.description: As an action, target a creature within 60 feet to make a Charisma saving throw. They take 2d8 force damage per karmic debt you discern (up to 18d8). On a failed save, they're restrained for rounds equal to debts discerned. On a success, they take half damage, have speed halved, and you gain temporary hit points equal to damage dealt.

ability.name: Magnetic Manipulation
ability.description: You can use an action to exert magnetic force on a metal object or creature within 60 feet. You can move the object or creature up to 10 feet in any direction, or cause the object to be attracted or repelled by a metal surface.

changes.oldValue: Gain proficiency with smith's tools if you don't already have it.
changes.newValue: You gain proficiency with smith's tools.

changes.oldValue: You can use a bonus action to pull or push a metal object weighing up to 10 pounds up to 10 feet towards or away from you. This can be used to manipulate weapons, tools, or similar objects in combat or to solve puzzles.
changes.newValue: As a bonus action, you can pull or push a metal object weighing up to 10 pounds within 60 feet, moving it up to 10 feet toward or away from you. If the object is carried or worn by a creature, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, you can choose to either move the creature along with the object or detach the object from the creature. For objects heavier or larger than the base limit, you can attempt to move them by making an Intelligence (Arcana) check against a DC determined by the object’s weight and size. Objects far beyond your power are immovable.

changes.oldValue: As a bonus action, you can temporarily sharpen a weapon, granting it a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls for the next hour.
changes.newValue: As a bonus action, you can temporarily sharpen a weapon or ammunition, granting it a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls for the next hour.

changes.oldValue: As a bonus action, you can magnetically attract a metal weapon you can see within 30 feet of you to your hand. This weapon does not provoke opportunity attacks while being drawn.
changes.newValue: As a reaction, you can magnetically attract a metal weapon you can see within 30 feet of you to your hand, provided it's not being worn or carried by another creature.

changes.oldValue: You gain proficiency in Perception checks to locate hidden gemstones or precious minerals. When you find such items, you can appraise their value with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check.
changes.newValue: You gain expertise in Perception checks to locate hidden gemstones or precious minerals. When you find such items, you can appraise their value with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check.

ability.name: Toxic Skin Secretion I
ability.description: Once per turn, when a creature hits you with a melee attack, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become poisoned until the end of its next turn.

ability.name: Vestibular Trance
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can target one poisoned creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be overwhelmed by distorted bodily sensations (nausea, vertigo, and loss of coordination) for the duration of its poisoned condition. While affected, the creature has disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws and ability checks. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

ability.name: Mutagen Formula (Strength)
ability.description: As a bonus action, when you drink a mutagen, you gain a +2 bonus to Strength for 10 minutes, and you take a –2 penalty to Intelligence for the same duration.

ability.name: Mutagen Formula (Dexterity)
ability.description: As a bonus action, when you drink a mutagen, you gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity for 10 minutes, and you take a –2 penalty to Wisdom for the same duration.

ability.name: Mutagen Formula (Constitution)
ability.description: As a bonus action, when you drink a mutagen, you gain a +2 bonus to Constitution for 10 minutes, and you take a –2 penalty to Charisma for the same duration.

ability.name: Mutagen Formula (Intelligence)
ability.description: As a bonus action, when you drink a mutagen, you gain a +2 bonus to Intelligence for 10 minutes, and you take a –2 penalty to Strength for the same duration.

ability.name: Mutagen Formula (Wisdom)
ability.description: As a bonus action, when you drink a mutagen, you gain a +2 bonus to Wisdom for 10 minutes, and you take a –2 penalty to Dexterity for the same duration.

ability.name: Mutagen Formula (Charisma)
ability.description: As a bonus action, when you drink a mutagen, you gain a +2 bonus to Charisma for 10 minutes, and you take a –2 penalty to Constitution for the same duration.

ability.name: Moonlit Verdant Beam
ability.description: As an action, you fire a beam of toxic moonlight at a creature within 60 feet. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 radiant damage + 3d6 poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target is blinded and poisoned until the end of your next turn.

ability.name: Toxic Skin Secretion II
ability.description: Once per turn, when a creature hits you with a melee attack, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become poisoned for 1 minute. On a failed save, the creature also takes poison damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

ability.name: Toxic Skin Secretion III
ability.description: Once per turn, when a creature hits you with a melee attack, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature becomes poisoned for 1 hour, takes poison damage equal to twice your proficiency bonus, and has its movement speed halved while poisoned this way.

ability.name: Vital Essence Sublimation III (Nilo)
ability.description:
Your success improves further: Common, Uncommon, and Rare potions no longer fail; only Very Rare (40%) and Legendary (60%) can fail.
You can now hold up to three distilled essences at a time.

ability.name: Apex Toxinator
ability.description: As an Action, you channel the pure essence of poison to conjure a monstrous, hissing Snake Horror in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet. The creature is friendly to you and your companions, acts immediately after you in the initiative order, and remains for 1 hour, until it drops to 0 hit points, or until you dismiss it as an action.

ability.name: Enhanced Mutagen
ability.description: As a bonus action, when you drink a mutagen, you can choose one ability score (Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution) to gain a +2 bonus for 10 minutes.

changes.oldValue: As a bonus action, you can drink a mutagen to gain advantage on Strength-based ability checks for 10 minutes. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to Strength-based attack rolls during this time.
changes.newValue: As a bonus action, you can drink a mutagen to gain a 1d4 bonus to strength based ability checks for 10 minutes.

changes.oldValue: As a bonus action, by drinking a specially prepared potion, you gain an additional 10 feet of movement speed for 10 minutes and advantage on Dexterity-based ability checks.
changes.newValue: As a bonus action, by drinking a specially prepared potion, you gain an additional 10 feet of movement speed for 10 minutes.

changes.oldValue: As an action, you can apply a specially crafted perfume that enhances your charm and charisma. For the next hour, you gain a 1d4 bonus to Charisma (Persuasion) and Charisma (Deception) checks against humanoids.
changes.newValue: As an action, you can apply a specially crafted perfume that enhances your charm and charisma. For the next hour, you gain a 1d4 bonus to Charisma (Persuasion) and Charisma (Deception) checks.

changes.oldValue: When you harvest the blood of a fallen creature with a Challenge Rating (CR) of 4 or lower, you can store its essence, preserving a fragment of its power. You can retain the essence of up to one creature at a time. For each stored essence, you can use one ability the creature possessed, provided it is an action, reaction, or bonus action and does not require spell slots or legendary actions. Once used, an essence is expended and must be replenished by harvesting fresh blood. Stored essences do not expire until used.
changes.newValue:
When you harvest the blood of a fallen creature, you can distill its essence into a single potion. You may either extract one of its abilities (action, bonus action, or reaction) and bottle it as a potion, or create a potion whose rarity depends on the creature’s level. Roll a d100; on a failure, the attempt is wasted.

- Initiate: Common (no failure chance)
- Adept: Uncommon (20% failure)
- Master: Rare (40% failure)
- Grandmaster: Very Rare (80% failure)
- Great Grandmaster: Legendary (100% failure)

You can hold only one distilled essence at a time. Potions do not expire.

changes.oldValue: As a bonus action, you can coat a weapon with a potent poison. The next attack you make with that weapon deals an additional 3d6 poison damage on a hit. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute.
changes.newValue: As a bonus action, you can coat a weapon with a potent poison. The next attack you make with that weapon deals an additional 2d6 poison damage on a hit. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute.

changes.oldValue: As an action, you can force a creature within 30 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is subjected to vivid hallucinations for 1 minute, during which it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks and mental saving throws. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
changes.newValue: As a bonus action, you can target one poisoned creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be subjected to vivid hallucinations for the duration of its poisoned condition. While affected by these hallucinations, the creature has disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws and ability checks. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

changes.oldValue: Harvest essence from fallen creatures of CR 8 or lower. Store up to 2 essences at a time.
changes.newValue:
Your failure chances are reduced: Common and Uncommon potions no longer fail, while higher rarity failure rates decrease (Rare 20%, Very Rare 60%, Legendary 80%).
You can now hold up to two distilled essences at a time.

ability.name: Draconic Regeneration of the Emerald Moon
ability.description: While under direct moonlight, you regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns. You can extend this regeneration to any creature within 60 feet by spending 1 essence point per creature at the start of your turn.

ability.name: Tide's Reflection Art III (Thalassios)
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can instantly swap places with one of your Water Clones without provoking opportunity attacks. Additinonally, you can now summon three Water Clones at the same time, and they last for 10 minutes.

ability.name: Lunar Tide
ability.description: As a reaction when you or creatures within 30 feet are subjected to a Dexterity saving throw against an ability that deals damage, you summon a protective wave of water guided by lunar force. All affected creatures reduce the damage taken by 2d8 + your spellcasting modifier. The water then dissipates harmlessly.

ability.name: Moonfall Condemnation
ability.description: As an Action, you target one creature within 120 feet. A pillar of concentrated moonlight descends, requiring a Dexterity saving throw against your essence ability save DC. On a failed save, the target takes 6d8 Radiant damage and 3d8 Cold damage, and is Restrained until the end of their next turn as lunar energy begins to calcify their limbs. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not Restrained. If this damage reduces the target to 50 hit points or fewer, they must immediately make a Constitution saving throw against your essence ability save DC. On a failed Constitution save, the creature is Petrified into moonstone

ability.name: Surface Strider
ability.description: You can walk on the surface of water and you gain advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks to maintain your balance while walking on slippery or unstable surfaces.

changes.oldValue: You can call forth a light rain within a 20-foot radius centered on you for 10 minutes. This rain lightly obscures the area, granting disadvantage on Perception checks relying on sight and extinguishing small fires.
changes.newValue: You can call forth a light rain within a 30-foot radius centered on you for 10 minutes. This rain lightly obscures the area, granting disadvantage on Perception checks relying on sight and extinguishing fires.

changes.oldValue: As a reaction, you can spend one spell slot and encase yourself in a barrier of ice, granting you temporary hit points equal to twice your spellcasting ability modifier + your spell level. This lasts for 1 minute.
changes.newValue: As a reaction, you can spend one spell slot and encase yourself in a barrier of ice, granting you temporary hit points equal to ten times the spell level used plus your spell casting modifier. This lasts for 1 hour.

ability.name: Entangling Reach
ability.description: As an action, you can target up to five creatures you can see within 120 feet, expending 1 point of Essence for each creature targeted. An unwilling target must make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (your choice, DC determined by your abilities). On a failed save, the creature is grappled. This grapple ignores the creature's weight, unless the creature is one size larger than you.

ability.name: Coiling Resilience
ability.description: You gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws for each creature you currently have grappled

ability.name: Heart Exchange
ability.description: As an action, choose a willing creature within 60 feet. You exchange hearts—roots of life intertwining your essences in profound gratitude. For the next hour, whenever one of you takes damage, both take half that damage. Whenever one regains hit points, both regain the same amount. You both gain advantage on all saving throws. This bond is unbreakable and lasts the full duration regardless of distance or conditions. You can maintain only one heart exchange at a time.

changes.oldValue: You can use your action to transform into a treelike creature. While in this form, you gain the following benefits:  - AC 17: Your skin becomes as tough as bark. - Hit Points: You gain temporary hit points equal to twice your level. - Attacks: You can make a slam attack with +6 to hit, dealing 2d6+4 bludgeoning damage. - Rooted: You can root yourself to the ground. While rooted, you cannot move, but you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws, and any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage. - This form lasts for 1 minute or until you use your action to revert to your normal form. You can use this feature once per long rest.
changes.newValue: You can use your action to transform into a treelike creature. While in this form, you gain the following benefits: - AC 17: Your skin becomes as tough as bark. - Hit Points: You gain temporary hit points equal to twice your level. - Attacks: You can make a slam attack with +6 to hit, dealing 2d6+4 bludgeoning damage. - Rooted: You can root yourself to the ground. While rooted, you cannot move, but you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws, and any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage. - This form lasts for 1 minute or until you use your action to revert to your normal form. You can use this feature once per long rest.

ability.description: As an action, you can create a powerful, improvised explosive from available materials. It deals 4d6 acid damage in a 10-foot radius on a failed Dexterity saving throw, or half as much on a successful save.

ability.name: Alchemy Proficiency
ability.description: Gain proficiency in Alchemist’s Supplies. You can craft basic alchemical substances, such as acid flasks, potions of healing, and other simple concoctions.

entries.commitMessage: Make builder for markdown support for abilities

ability.name: Acidic Insight
ability.description: You have developed a keen understanding of acidic substances and their effects. ability.description: Your swimming speed equals your walking speed. Additionally, you gain the ability to breathe underwater and move through water at your normal speed without penalty.

ability.name: Frozen Insight
ability.description: You can temporarily turn your thoughts into ice, allowing you to gain deep insight into a complex problem or puzzle. For 1 hour, you gain advantage on Intelligence checks related to solving mysteries or understanding arcane knowledge.

changes.oldValue: As an action, you create a 20-foot radius of gentle rain centered on you that lasts for a number of rounds equal to your maximum Water essences. At the end of each of their turns while in the rain, they regain 1 hit point.
changes.newValue: As an action, you create a 20-foot radius of gentle rain centered on you that lasts for a number of rounds equal to your maximum Water essences. At the start of each of their turns while in the rain, they regain 1 hit point.

changes.oldValue: You can summon a powerful wave of water that heals and revitalizes. As an action, you create a wave that washes over allies in a 30-foot radius, restoring hit points equal to 3d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This wave also removes one condition affecting allies (charmed, frightened, or poisoned). This ability’s healing increases by 1d8 when you reach 9th Master level (4d8), 11th Grandmaster level (5d8), and 17th Great-Grandmaster level (6d8).
changes.newValue: You can summon a powerful wave of water that heals and revitalizes. As an action, you create a wave that washes over allies in a 30-foot radius, restoring hit points equal to 3d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

ability.name: Verdant Armor
ability.description: As a bonus action, you encase yourself in a layer of living wood and leaves for 1 minute. At the start of each of your turns while this armor is active, you regain hit points equal to 1d6.

ability.name: Needle Barrage
ability.description: You unleash a torrent of wooden needles that streak toward one creature you can see within range. The target makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure: 8d4 piercing damage and is riddled with needles, reducing its speed by half until the end of your next turn. On a success: half damage and no speed reduction.

ability.name: Verdant Armor
ability.description: As bonus action, you can envelop yourself in a protective layer of magically enhanced bark and vines. For the next hour, you gain temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + your proficiency bonus. Additionally, you have resistance to bludgeoning, slashing and piercing damage.

changes.oldValue: When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to cause thorns to erupt from your skin. The attacker takes 1d4 piercing damage. This ability’s damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th Adept level (2d4), 9th Master level (3d4), 13th Grandmaster level (4d4), and 17th Great-grandmaster level (5d4).
changes.newValue: When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to cause thorns to erupt from your skin. The attacker takes 4d4 piercing damage.

entries.commitMessage: add abilities, fix colors and add netlify file

ability.name: Whispers of the Gale (Laura)
ability.description: When you miss with a ranged attack roll (including spell attacks), you can use your reaction and expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to reroll the attack. You must use the new roll, and the spell slot is expended regardless of the outcome.

entries.commitMessage: add abilities, fix colors and add netlify file

ability.name: Heart Crusher Grip (Nilo)
ability.description: As an action, you can target one bloodied creature you can see within 15 feet of you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 5d6 fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, their heart is crushed and they die instantly.

entries.commitMessage: add abilities, fix colors and add netlify file

ability.name: Venomous Bite (Gio)
ability.description: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with a bite attack, imbuing it with a potent venom. Make a melee weapon attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 piercing damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become poisoned for 1 minute. The bite attack is considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

entries.commitMessage: add abilities, fix colors and add netlify file

ability.name: Vital Essence Sublimation I (Nilo)
ability.description: When you harvest the blood of a fallen creature with a Challenge Rating (CR) of 4 or lower, you can store its essence, preserving a fragment of its power. You can retain the essence of up to one creature at a time. For each stored essence, you can use one ability the creature possessed, provided it is an action, reaction, or bonus action and does not require spell slots or legendary actions. Once used, an essence is expended and must be replenished by harvesting fresh blood. Stored essences do not expire until used.

entries.commitMessage: add abilities, fix colors and add netlify file

ability.name: Vital Essence Sublimation II (Nilo)
ability.description: Harvest essence from fallen creatures of CR 8 or lower. Store up to 2 essences at a time.

entries.commitMessage: add abilities, fix colors and add netlify file

ability.name: Tide’s Reflection Art I (Thalassios)
ability.description: As a bonus action, you summon a Water Clone in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet. The clone lasts for 1 minute or until destroyed. The clone is linked to your senses, allowing you to cast spells through it as if you were in its space. The clone has the following stats: Armor Class: Your spell save DC (8 + proficiency bonus + spellcasting modifier). Hit Points: Equal to half your hit point maximum. Speed: Equal to your swimming speed. Immunity: Cold damage. Resistance: Fire damage. Vulnerability: Lightning damage. As a bonus action, you can command the clone to move and take one of the following actions: Melee Spell Attack: Range 10 feet, dealing 1d8 + your spellcasting modifier cold damage. Ranged Spell Attack: Range 60 feet, dealing 1d6 + your spellcasting modifier cold damage. Take the Dash, Dodge, or Disengage action.

entries.commitMessage: add abilities, fix colors and add netlify file

ability.name: Tide’s Reflection Art II (Thalassios)
ability.description: As a reaction, you can cause your one of your Water Clones to detonate, dealing cold damage equal to its maximum hit points in a 10-foot radius. Creatures in range must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take full damage, or half as much on a success. You can now summon two Water Clones at the same time, increasing the damage by one damage dice.

ability.name: Expanded Explosion
ability.description: Your expertise in crafting explosives has improved the effectiveness of your bombs. When you create or use an explosive device, you increase its radius by 5 feet. For example, a bomb that normally affects a 10-foot radius now affects a 15-foot radius. This increased radius applies to all explosive effects you create, including those from your Improvised Explosives and any similar abilities. This ability’s range increases by 5 feet when you reach 9th Master level (10-foot), and by 10 feet 17th Great-Grandmaster level (20-foot).

ability.name: Caustic Bomb
ability.description: As an action, you can create a powerful, improvised explosive from available materials. It deals 3d6 acid damage in a 10-foot radius on a failed Dexterity saving throw, or half as much on a successful save. This ability’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th Adept level (4d6), 9th Master level (5d6), 13th Grandmaster level (6d6), and 17th Great-Grandmaster level (7d6).

ability.name: Alchemy Proficiency
ability.description: Gain proficiency in Alchemist’s Supplies. You can craft basic alchemical substances, such as acid flasks, potions of healing, and other simple concoctions.

ability.name: Acidic Insight
ability.description: You have developed a keen understanding of acidic substances and their effects. You gain advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) and Wisdom (Nature) checks related to acids, alchemical reactions, and chemical processes. This knowledge allows you to identify and analyse unknown substances or toxins with ease.

ability.name: Acidic Precision
ability.description: Your expertise with corrosive substances has honed your skill in turning everyday objects into deadly weapons. You gain proficiency with all thrown weapons and improvised thrown weapons.

ability.name: Chemical Expertise
ability.description: You can create more advanced alchemical mixtures, such as potent acid flasks or alchemical fire. You gain a +2 bonus to checks involving Alchemist’s Supplies and can create these mixtures in half the usual time.

ability.name: Chaos Manipulation
ability.description: Once per long rest, you can cause a minor chaotic effect within 30 feet, such as causing objects to tremble, flicker, or shift unpredictably. The effect lasts for 1 minute and can create distractions or disorient opponents.

ability.name: Explosive Savant
ability.description: When you use an explosive device or alchemical flask, its damage increases by an additional damage dice. Additionally, you can use such devices as a bonus action instead of an action.

ability.name: Miasmic Cloud
ability.description: You can create a cloud of acidic mist in a 10-foot radius around you. Any creature that starts its turn within the cloud must make a Constitution saving throw or take 2d6 acid damage and be blinded until the end of its next turn. This ability’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 9th Master level (3d6), 13th Grandmaster level (4d6), and 17th Great-Grandmaster level (5d6).

ability.name: Acidic Embrace
ability.description: You can magically coat a weapon or object in a layer of corrosive acid. The weapon deals an additional 2d6 acid damage on a successful hit, and the object corrodes any non-magical material it touches. This effect lasts for 1 minute

ability.name: Gale Force Strike
ability.description: When you hit a creature of your size or smaller, or any creature one size category larger than you, with a weapon, you can create a gust of wind that forces the creature to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed 10 feet away from you. The distance increases by an additional 10 feet at 5th Adept level (20 feet), 9th Master level (30 feet), 13th Grandmaster level (40 feet), and 17th Great-grandmaster level (50 feet). This effect can be used once per turn.

ability.name: Misty Escape
ability.description: When you take damage, you can use your reaction to turn into a cloud of mist, causing the attack to miss. You must spend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to use this ability.

ability.name: Mistbound Step
ability.description: The Misty Step spell does not consume a spell slot if you begin or end your movement in a heavily obscured area.

ability.name: Misty Veil
ability.description: You can create a shroud of mist around you that obscures your appearance, granting advantage on Stealth checks to hide and disadvantage on Insight checks to discern your true intentions. This effect lasts for 1 hour.

ability.name: Wind Sprint
ability.description: You can double your movement speed for 1 minute.

ability.name: Thunderous Roar
ability.description: You can let out a powerful roar that creates a shockwave, forcing all creatures within 10 feet to make a Constitution saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you and become deafened for 1 minute.

ability.name: Sound Analysis
ability.description: You can accurately determine the source and direction of any sound within 300 feet of you. This ability can be used to track creatures or detect hidden enemies. It provides you advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks related to sound.

ability.name: Echoing Footsteps
ability.description: You can move with such speed and silence that your footsteps echo faintly. You gain advantage on Stealth checks, and creatures within 10 feet of you have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to hear you. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.

ability.name: Thunderstep
ability.description: You can use a bonus action to make a sudden, loud noise, creating a brief but intense thunderclap that can be heard up to 300 feet away. Creatures within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. This ability’s range increases by 10 feet when you reach 9th Master level (40 feet), 11th Grandmaster level (50 feet), and 17th Great-Grandmaster level (60 feet).

ability.name: Calm Breeze
ability.description: You can use a bonus action to create a soothing breeze that relaxes and calms creatures within a 30-foot radius, providing them with advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.

ability.name: Whispering Winds
ability.description: You can use your action to send a message carried by the wind to any creature within 1 mile of you. The message is heard as a whisper by the intended recipient. This ability allows for secret communications or covert information exchange.

ability.name: Wind Barrier
ability.description: As a reaction to being targeted by an attack or harmful spell, you can summon a barrier of wind around you. You gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws until the start of your next turn. Additionally, ranged weapon attacks against you have disadvantage.

ability.name: Cyclone Step
ability.description: When you use the Dash action, you can create a swirling vortex of wind around you. Creatures within 5 feet of your path must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The wind dissipates at the end of your movement.

ability.name: Stonecunning
ability.description: Gain proficiency in History. If already proficient, add double your proficiency bonus to History checks related to the origin of stonework.

ability.name: Miner\'s Touch
ability.description: Gain proficiency with mason’s tools and miner’s tools.

ability.name: Rock Whisperer
ability.description: You can communicate simple ideas with earth elementals and creatures of stone.

ability.name: Earth Sense
ability.description: You have advantage on Survival and Perception checks to navigate underground or in rocky terrain.

ability.name: Stone Fist
ability.description: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage and count as magical for overcoming resistance and immunity. The damage dice increase to 1d8 at 5th Adept level, 1d10 at 9th Master level, and 1d12 at 11th Grandmaster level.

ability.name: Pebble Barrage
ability.description: As an action, you hurl a handful of pebbles at creatures within 30 feet. Make a ranged spell attack for each pebble (up to 3 pebbles), each targeting any creature of your choice within range. Each hit deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage. If the same target is hit by three consecutive pebbles in the same turn, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The number of pebbles you can hurl increases by 1 when you reach 5th Adept level (4 pebbles), 9th Master level (5 pebbles), 13th Grandmaster level (6 pebbles), and 17th Great-grandmaster level (7 pebbles).

ability.name: Earthen Resilience
ability.description: Gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws.

ability.name: Terramancer
ability.description: Gain expertise (double proficiency bonus) in Athletics when performing tasks involving lifting, pushing, or pulling heavy objects made of stone or earth.

ability.name: Stone Camouflage
ability.description: You have advantage on Stealth checks to hide in rocky terrain or against stone surfaces.

ability.name: Earthen Grasp
ability.description: As an action to cause the ground to grasp a creature within 30 feet, restraining it for 1 minute. The target can make a Strength saving throw at the end of each of its turns to break free.

ability.name: Stone Armor
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can encase yourself in a layer of stone, granting you resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute.

ability.name: Sandstorm
ability.description: As an action, you create a swirling storm of sand in a 20-foot radius centred on you. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d6 slashing damage on a failed save and becoming blinded until the end of their next turn, or half as much damage on a successful save. The storm lasts for 1 minute. The area is difficult terrain, any creature that starts its turn within the storm takes 1d6 damage. This ability’s range increases by 10-foot when you reach 9th Master level (30-foot radius), 13th Grandmaster level (40-foot radius) and 17th Great-grandmaster level (50-foot radius).

ability.name: Flame Ward
ability.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed while within 10 feet of a source of fire or heat.

ability.name: Searing Gaze
ability.description: When you focus intently on a creature for 1 minute, you can attempt an Intimidation check. If successful, the creature is unsettled and has disadvantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed by you for 1 hour.

ability.name: Ember Strike
ability.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a spell slot to deal an additional 1d12 fire damage per level of the spell slot expended.

ability.name: Flame Lash
ability.description: You can use your action to create a whip-like tendril of fire that extends up to 15 feet. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes fire damage equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. The intense heat also causes the target to become dazzled, giving them disadvantage on their next attack roll. This ability’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

ability.name: Inferno Disengage
ability.description: When you use the Disengage action, you create a burst of fire around you. Each creature within 5 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d6 fire damage and catches fire. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage The damage increases by 1d6 at 5th Adept level (2d6), 9th Master level (3d6), 13th Grandmaster level (4d6), and 17th Great-grandmaster level (5d6).

ability.name: Blazing Presence
ability.description: Your fiery aura gives you a commanding presence. You can use your action to create a burst of heat and light, giving you advantage on Intimidation checks and causing those who fail a Wisdom saving throw to be frightened until the end of your next turn.

ability.name: Flame Kinship
ability.description: You gain the ability to communicate with creatures of fire, such as Fire Elementals and Magmin, as if you shared a common language. This does not grant you the ability to control or command them but allows for basic communication and understanding.

ability.name: Ember\'s Resilience
ability.description: You can channel the residual heat around you to bolster your own resistance. When you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead taking 2d6 of fire damage.

ability.name: Blazing Trail
ability.description: When you take the dash action, you can leave a trail of fire in your wake. For the duration of the movement, any creature that moves through or ends its turn in a 10-foot-wide line you create takes fire damage equal to twice your spellcasting ability modifier. This trail lasts for 1 minute or until you choose to end it.

ability.name: Scorched Ground
ability.description: As an action, you can cause a 20-foot radius area on the ground to become superheated within 120 feet of you for 1 minute. Creatures that start their turn in this area take fire damage equal to 2d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. The area is difficult terrain, and the fire persists even if you move away from it. This ability’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 9th Master level (3d6), 13th Grandmaster level (4d6), and 17th Great-grandmaster level (5d6).

ability.name: Thunderous Strike
ability.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can channel the force of a thunderstorm into your strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. This ability can only be used once per turn, and once a creature is stunned by this ability, it cannot be stunned again by it for 1 minute.

ability.name: Static Reflexes
ability.description: You gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that deal lightning damage or require quick reflexes, such as traps or spells.

ability.name: Lightning Step
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can harness the power of lightning to enhance your movement. Your jump distance is tripled, and your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks until the end of your turn.

ability.name: Stormborn Presence
ability.description: When you make a Charisma (Persuasion) or Charisma (Intimidation) check to influence a group of people, you can invoke your stormy presence to gain advantage on the roll.

ability.name: Storm Navigator
ability.description: Your understanding of storms helps you predict their patterns and avoid hazards. You gain proficiency in Navigator’s Tools and have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate or map out sea routes in stormy weather.

ability.name: Lightning Insight
ability.description: When on or near water, you can use your connection to lightning to sense changes in weather. You can use a bonus action to gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to spot distant ships, landmarks, or other navigation hazards.

ability.name: Thunderous Speed
ability.description: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, you can take the Dash action as a bonus action.

ability.name: Conductive Touch
ability.description: When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 lightning damage.

ability.name: Lightning Sense
ability.description: You have developed a heightened sense of awareness in stormy or electrically charged environments. You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to notice hidden details or track creatures in such conditions.

ability.name: Electrostatic Charm
ability.description: Your affinity with lightning allows you to charm and influence those you meet. You can use your Charisma (Deception) or Charisma (Performance) checks to impress or beguile others, gaining advantage in social situations where you can appeal to your stormy, dynamic persona.

ability.name: Thunderous Entrance
ability.description: You can make a dramatic entrance by creating a booming thunderclap that announces your presence. This effect grants you advantage on Charisma (Performance) checks to make a memorable first impression.

ability.name: Metalcrafting
ability.description: Gain proficiency with smith\'s tools if you don\'t already have it.

ability.name: Magnetic Attraction
ability.description: You can use a bonus action to pull or push a metal object weighing up to 10 pounds up to 10 feet towards or away from you. This can be used to manipulate weapons, tools, or similar objects in combat or to solve puzzles.

ability.name: Metal Sense
ability.description: You can detect the presence of metal within 30 feet of you. You sense the type and general location of metal objects, including hidden compartments or concealed weapons.

ability.name: Keen Edge
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can temporarily sharpen a weapon, granting it a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls for the next hour.

ability.name: Magnetic Focus
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can magnetically attract a metal weapon you can see within 30 feet of you to your hand. This weapon does not provoke opportunity attacks while being drawn.

ability.name: Metallic Echo
ability.description: When you strike a metallic object with a melee weapon, you can create a ringing sound that echoes in a 10-foot radius. Creatures in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be deafened until the end of their next turn.

ability.name: Enhanced Armor
ability.description: You can spend 10 minutes to reinforce any armor. For the next hour, you gain resistance to one type of damage (chosen when you use this ability) while wearing armor.

ability.name: Magnetic Manipulation
ability.description: You can use an action to exert magnetic force on a metal object or creature within 30 feet. You can move the object or creature up to 10 feet in any direction, or cause the object to be attracted or repelled by a metal surface.

ability.name: Gemsight
ability.description: You gain proficiency in Perception checks to locate hidden gemstones or precious minerals. When you find such items, you can appraise their value with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check.

ability.name: Magnetic Shield
ability.description: As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can create a magnetic field that reduces the damage by 1d10 + your Constitution modifier. If the attacker is wielding a metal weapon, they must make a Strength saving throw or be disarmed.

ability.name: Steel Tornado
ability.description: As an action, you can create a whirlwind of metallic shards in a 10-foot radius and 30-foot tall cylinder centered on you. Creatures within the cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 slashing damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. The damage increases to 3d6 at 9th Master level, 4d6 at 13th Grandmaster level, and 5d6 at Great-grandmaster 17th level.

ability.name: Venomous Touch
ability.description: As an action, you can imbue your touch with a mild poison. A creature you touch must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned this way, the creature takes 1d4 poison damage at the start of each of its turns until it succeeds a saving throw. The poison ends early if the creature receives any kind of healing. This ability’s damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th Adept level (2d4), 9th Master level (3d4), 13th Grandmaster level (4d4), and 17th Great-grandmaster level (5d4).

ability.name: Herbalist’s Knowledge
ability.description: You gain proficiency with the Medicine skill and advantage on checks to identify or use medicinal herbs and poisons.

ability.name: Elixir of Vitality
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can consume a special elixir to regain hit dice. You regain a number of hit dice equal to half your proficiency bonus (minimum of one).

ability.name: Strength Booster
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can drink a mutagen to gain advantage on Strength-based ability checks and saving throws for 10 minutes. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to Strength-based attack rolls during this time.

ability.name: Quickening Draught
ability.description: As a bonus action, by drinking a specially prepared potion, you gain an additional 10 feet of movement speed for 1 hour and advantage on Dexterity-based ability checks.

ability.name: Enchanting Perfume
ability.description: As an action, you can apply a specially crafted perfume that enhances your charm and charisma. For the next hour, you gain a 1d4 bonus to Charisma (Persuasion) and Charisma (Deception) checks against humanoids.

ability.name: Venomous Strike
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can coat a weapon with a potent poison. The next attack you make with that weapon deals an additional 2d6 poison damage on a hit. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute.

ability.name: Hallucinogenic Trance
ability.description: As an action, you can force a creature within 30 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is subjected to vivid hallucinations for 1 minute, during which it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks and mental saving throws. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

ability.name: Enhanced Mutagen
ability.description: As a bonus action, when you drink a mutagen, you can choose one ability score (Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution) to gain a +2 bonus for 10 minutes.

ability.name: Pill of Focus
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can consume a pill to gain advantage on concentration checks for the next hour. Additionally, you can maintain concentration on up to one additional poison spell or ability for the duration.

ability.name: Venomous Precision
ability.description: When attacking a creature that is poisoned, you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature. Starting at 9th Master level, when you hit a poisoned creature with a weapon attack, you deal an extra 1d6 poison damage. This bonus damage increases to 2d6 at 13th Grandmaster level and 3d6 at 17th Great-grandmaster level.

ability.name: Echoes of the Deep
ability.description: You can communicate with aquatic creatures or spirits of water, allowing you to understand their language and gain information about underwater locations or hidden treasures.

ability.name: Ice Form
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can turn your body into ice for 1 minute. You gain resistance to cold and fire damage and your movement speed is reduced by 10 feet.

ability.name: Raincaller
ability.description: You can call forth a light rain within a 20-foot radius centered on you for 10 minutes. This rain lightly obscures the area, granting disadvantage on Perception checks relying on sight and extinguishing small fires.

ability.name: Restorative Rain
ability.description: As an action, you create a 20-foot radius of gentle rain centered on you that lasts for a number of rounds equal to your maximum Water essences. At the end of each of their turns while in the rain, they regain 1 hit point.

ability.name: Aqua Agility
ability.description: Your swimming speed equals your walking speed. Additionally, you gain the ability to breathe underwater and move through water at your normal speed without penalty.

ability.name: Tide of Emotions
ability.description: By channelling the ebb and flow of water, you can influence the emotions of others within a 30-foot radius. Choose one emotion (calm, fear, or joy); affected creatures must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be overwhelmed by that emotion for 1 hour.

ability.name: Tidal Surge
ability.description: You can summon a powerful wave of water that heals and revitalizes. As an action, you create a wave that washes over allies in a 30-foot radius, restoring hit points equal to 3d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This wave also removes one condition affecting allies (charmed, frightened, or poisoned). This ability’s healing increases by 1d8 when you reach 9th Master level (4d8), 11th Grandmaster level (5d8), and 17th Great-Grandmaster level (6d8).

ability.name: Frozen Insight
ability.description: You can temporarily turn your thoughts into ice, allowing you to gain deep insight into a complex problem or puzzle. For 1 hour, you gain advantage on Intelligence checks related to solving mysteries or understanding arcane knowledge.

ability.name: Rain of Revelation
ability.description: You can summon a gentle, magical rain that grants clarity and insight to those who stand in it. Allies within a 20-foot radius can ask one question about their future or destiny, and you provide a vague but helpful answer based on your understanding of the world.

ability.name: Glacial Shield
ability.description: As a reaction, you can spend one spell slot and encase yourself in a barrier of ice, granting you temporary hit points equal to twice your spellcasting ability modifier + your spell level. This lasts for 1 minute.

ability.name: Hydroportation
ability.description: As a bonus action, you can teleport up to 60 feet to a space you can see within a body of water or mist. You must be in contact with the water or mist to use this ability.

ability.name: Surface Strider
ability.description: You can walk on the surface of water and you gain advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks to maintain your balance while walking on slippery or unstable surfaces.

ability.name: Vine Manipulation
ability.description: You gain the ability to manipulate vines and roots within 30 feet of you. As an action, you can cause vines to emerge from the ground or surrounding vegetation to ensnare a creature or create barriers. The vines can grapple or restrain a creature (Strength saving throw) or create difficult terrain in a 10-foot square area for 1 minute.

ability.name: Verdant Armor
ability.description: As bonus action, you can envelop yourself in a protective layer of magically enhanced bark and vines. For the next hour, you gain temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + your proficiency bonus. Additionally, you have resistance to bludgeoning, slashing and piercing damage.

ability.name: Fertile Ground Resilience
ability.description: When you are standing on or above fertile soil (such as grasslands, forests, or similar natural terrain), you can use your reaction to gain immunity to effects that would knock you prone or push you away. Additionally, while on such terrain, you gain advantage on saving throws against being grappled or restrained.

ability.name: Thorny Defence
ability.description: When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to cause thorns to erupt from your skin. The attacker takes 1d4 piercing damage. This ability’s damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th Adept level (2d4), 9th Master level (3d4), 13th Grandmaster level (4d4), and 17th Great-grandmaster level (5d4).

ability.name: Woodcraft
ability.description: You gain proficiency with woodcarver’s tools and the ability to craft simple wooden items. You can create small wooden objects (e.g., a carved figurine, a simple tool) in 1 hour, provided you have access to suitable materials. You can also use your tools to make minor repairs to wooden objects.

ability.name: Plant Bond
ability.description: You can communicate with plants in a basic way. You understand their emotions and can ask simple questions (e.g., \"Where is the nearest source of water?\"). Plants can also provide you with basic information about their immediate surroundings.

ability.name: Woodland Stride
ability.description: Moving through nonmagical plant life, such as undergrowth or vines, costs you no extra movement. You can also move through difficult terrain caused by plant life without penalty.

ability.name: Nature’s Insight
ability.description: You gain proficiency in Nature and Survival skills. If you are already proficient in either of these skills, you gain expertise, doubling your proficiency bonus for those skills.

ability.name: Tree Form
ability.description: You can use your action to transform into a treelike creature. While in this form, you gain the following benefits:  - AC 17: Your skin becomes as tough as bark. - Hit Points: You gain temporary hit points equal to twice your level. - Attacks: You can make a slam attack with +6 to hit, dealing 2d6+4 bludgeoning damage. - Rooted: You can root yourself to the ground. While rooted, you cannot move, but you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws, and any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage. - This form lasts for 1 minute or until you use your action to revert to your normal form. You can use this feature once per long rest.
